p: The molecular markers AFLP and ITS2 were efficient in separating L. alba and L. lupulina, and in grouping L. origanoides, L. origanoides × velutina, L. velutina, L. sidoides, L. salviifolia, and L. grata. Moreover, the markers revealed the existence of intra- and inter-specific variability within the genus, as well as the close phylogenetic relationship between L. alba and L. lupulina. Since individuals grouped in L. origanoides exhibit morphological diversity and variability regarding the major constituents of the essential oils, the selection of genotypes for the production of certified phytomedicines must be based on the chemical profile of the oil produced.
